cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 320 mi south-southwest of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Accelerating north then north-northeast, aiming for the southeastern Louisiana coast, then sweeping inland across MS-AL-GA and off the Mid-Atlantic coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch from west of Morgan City LA to Intracoastal City LA
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warning Morgan City LA to the MS/AL border (including New Orleans); Tropical-storm warning MS/AL border to Walton/Bay County line FL; Storm-surge warning mouth of Atchafalaya River LA to Navarre FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast (LA-MS-AL-FL Panhandle) then inland across GA and the U.S. East Coast to the Mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible (most guidance 2-4 inches, isolated heavier cells could exceed 4 inches)
weather_observation.wind: Gusty conditions possible late Wed night–Thu (peak gusts 30–40 mph); sustained tropical-storm force winds unlikely (≤4% chance)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Georgia coast; surge threat confined to northern Gulf Coast well west of Savannah
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain 2–4 in with pockets of 4+ in possible, leading to brief urban or low-lying flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: A brief, isolated tornado cannot be ruled out as the remnant core moves across Georgia
